metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Tacoma. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

advisors.name: Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Karley Schluter, CFP®|ChFC®

heroDescription: Tacoma, Washington, is a vibrant city known for its rich history and diverse economy.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 203,446, Tacoma serves as a key economic hub in the Pacific Northwest. The city benefits from its proximity to Seattle and a growing port industry.
uniqueNeeds: Tacoma requires a focus on sustainable growth and infrastructure improvements to support its expanding population.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Tacoma's tech and manufacturing sectors face volatility; diversify investments. Real estate is rising fast, indicating bubble risks. Prepare for earthquakes and flooding.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Tacoma's economy has shown resilience with a 3% growth rate, driven by manufacturing and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Tacoma is $75,000, reflecting a diverse economic base and skilled workforce.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Tacoma are increasingly focusing on retirement planning and real estate investments.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), Tacoma's cost of living is 10% lower than the national average, making it an attractive place for new residents.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), Tacoma's housing market has seen a 12% increase in home prices over the past year, raising concerns about affordability.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Tacoma's business climate is improving, with incentives for startups and established companies alike.
